page.title: 03Conservation
page.content: The older part of Barrowby village has been designated a conservation area. The church of All Saints is the oldest building in Barrowby and was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. It is a grade one listed building. There are other listed buildings (grade 2) within the area, these being - Barrowby Old Hall, Barrowby House, Summerhouse to Barrowby House, Brydon House, Malting House and Hall Cottage. Anyone wishing to demolish a building in the conservation area must apply to the District Planning Authority. Also any alterations or extensions to be made to a building must be designed and constructed in materials similar to the original building. Residents are asked that hedgerows, trees and walls are kept in their original positions wherever possible.
